snippet.title: Tiny Brunswick block sold $320,000 above reserve - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
A 133sq m vacant block at the rear of , has sold for $870,000.
A DIMINUTIVE block in Brunswick has sold for $870,000 in an eight-bidder battle that amazed even its sales agent. The tiny 133sq m block at the rear of was surrounded by commercial buildings and used as an unofficial carpark. But eight bidders swooped on the block when it went to auction today, submitting 41 bids in just 20 minutes, ending in a sale $320,000 more than the reserve. Vision Real Estate Fitzroy sales agent Frank Romeo said he was "blown out of the water" by the result.
Vision Real Estate auctioneer James Doherty and sales agent Frank Romeo were hard-pressed to keep up with the auction action at 93-95 Sydney Rd, Brunswick. Photo: Graham Hosking Photography
"We didn't expect it go up to $870,000," he said. "You can just about buy a house for this price."
73 Mitchell St, Brunswick, sold for $893,000 in July, 2017.
Mr Romeo is not far wrong, with a renovated Victorian terrace at , sold for $893,000 last month. The two-bedroom abode was on a similar sized allotment to the vacant block. And in June, a three-level, three-bedroom unit at was snapped up for $890,000.
32 Amelia St, Brunswick was snapped up for $890,000 in June, 2017.
And according to CoreLogic figures, Brunswick's median unit price is $510,000. Mr Romeo said inquiries before the auction were "very good and strong", indicating the auction would end in a great price. "But this doesn't happen often," he said. Mr Romeo said an investor snapped up the block, which is zoned Commercial 1, with plans to build a commercial-retail building on the site.
